items.sentence: According to the paper, it will snow tomorrow.
This clock must\'ve belonged to Tom\'s father.
Tom packed a lunch for Mary to take to school.
If Tom calls, tell him I\'ll be there by 2:30.
I expect to be paid for this work by tomorrow.
I forgot to tell you how much you need to pay.
Tom\'s remarks touched off a violent argument.
Tom doesn\'t have enough money to buy a house.
Tom doesn\'t have to get up so early tomorrow.
Tom pulled out his knife and peeled the apple.
Tom and Mary weren\'t able to help me do that.
I have to hand in my report by next Wednesday.
Tom opened his desk drawer and took out a pen.
Why isn\'t there any food in the refrigerator?
Would you like to have dinner with us tonight?
Do you want to go grab a hot dog or something?
Does Tom still come to Boston every Christmas?
Tom\'s apartment is infested with cockroaches.
No one bought anything Tom was trying to sell.
No one knows exactly when we need to be there.
